channel.title: Ubuntu, WINE
channel.description: Okay, I was just wondering if WINE is capable of running a Pserv? I'm buying a Dedi and going to have it in my house for my Pserv and was wondering what would be less effort. I'm not too bothered if Window's is the only easy option. Just wanted to see if I could save a few $.

item.title: Ubuntu, WINE
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:5, topic:419426”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=521973.msg3794402#msg3794402 date=1319513022]
If you’re running a RSPS, which is in Java, you don’t need WINE…
[/quote]
how else are you suppose to run the .bat files? herp durp…[/quote]
Can’t tell if trolling or just stupid

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu, WINE
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:23, topic:419426”][quote author=t4 link=topic=521973.msg3796279#msg3796279 date=1319657490]

#!/bin/sh
java -cp external1.jar:external2.jar com.moparscape.rsps.Server 43594

You guys are fucking retarded.
[/quote]

You said nothing that wasn’t already said.[/quote]
what u think ur a big man wlee listn up u fag i was head programmar at 12 years old and accepted a nobal prise latar that year i have helped presedent obama with national cecurety and his genearal day of live and got collage degree at same time so fuck you i say again fuck YOU noob get on MY level

item.title: Ubuntu, WINE
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:20, topic:419426”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=521973.msg3794695#msg3794695 date=1319547419]

I don’t know how shit ubuntu is but all you should do is:

apt-get install sun-java6-jdk sun-java6-jre
java nameOfMainClass
[/quote]You’ve got to enable the “Canonical Partners” repo to get Sun.

Oh right, i completely forgot that oracle are being assholes and saying “HURR ONLY WE SHOULD DISTRIBUTE JAVA” which has basically made it so much more annoying to install.

Even though it’s horrid and I really don’t recommend using it, you could always use openjdk and should be able to install with:
sudo apt-get install openjdk-6-jre openjdk-6-jdk
(You can replace the 6’s with 7’s if you wish to install java 7)[/quote]

Actually, I found out that they’re not distributing java 7. You have to download it from oracle and install it yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu, WINE
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:17, topic:419426”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=521973.msg3794594#msg3794594 date=1319537259]
I don’t know how shit ubuntu is but all you should do is:

apt-get install sun-java6-jdk sun-java6-jre
java nameOfMainClass
[/quote]You’ve got to enable the “Canonical Partners” repo to get Sun.[/quote]

Oh right, i completely forgot that oracle are being assholes and saying “HURR ONLY WE SHOULD DISTRIBUTE JAVA” which has basically made it so much more annoying to install.

Even though it’s horrid and I really don’t recommend using it, you could always use openjdk and should be able to install with:
sudo apt-get install openjdk-6-jre openjdk-6-jdk
(You can replace the 6’s with 7’s if you wish to install java 7)

Read full topic

When you install the Java from the command line, it sets all the alternatives for you.

item.title: Ubuntu, WINE
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:13, topic:419426”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=521973.msg3794546#msg3794546 date=1319523628]

Why do people always think that they need to use WINE? That’s just fucking retarded.

Did I say that its the only way? Way to be rude & dumb.

No, you didn’t say that it was the only way, but from the contents of this thread, you want to do just that. Use Ubuntu & wine to run a private server. Why would you want to choose the obviously inferior method?

Cause I don’t care as long as it works? Yes, I want to do that but your statement doesn’t make sense. Reword it.

“Hey, let’s use wine, a windows emulator, install java, and use it from there, even though you can install java on ubuntu with one command, with increased performance.”
[/quote]
But wouldn’t you have to change the pathe’s:S? See thats the difference between me and you, I actually found it hard to do that… Your good with this type of thing I’m not, I cba spending like an hour tryna do it again.[/quote]

Or you can literally copy the line that executes the server, change the semicolons to colons, and it will work exactly as expected.

4 second google search.

Read full topic

[/quote]
